subject: Re: [junit] req for books
msgSnippet: JUnit is covered briefly in the eXtreme Programming seris as well.  But the information is mostly on the this is cool so use it level and not on the
messageBody:
JUnit is covered briefly in the "eXtreme Programming" seris as well. But
the information is mostly on the "this is cool so use it" level and not on
the technical level.


--- Levi Cook <lcook@...> wrote:
> I haven't found too many JUnit resources in hard copy, but I also
> haven't
> dug too deeply. The one hard copy reference I found, was in Martin
> Fowlers
> book titled "Refactoring".
>
> If memory serves, it contains one full chapter on unit testing w/ JUnit.
>
> HTH,
> Levi Cook
>
